availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky farmer. Kentucky native. Married Jane Hinton. Father of Julia A. Hinton, Elizabeth Hinton, Rachael Hinton, Squire Hinton, Lucinda Hinton, Nelson Hinton, and Elihu Hinton.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 589. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 83. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 29. “David Hinton (1812-1879),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 82101933, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=82101933&ref=acom (accessed June 16, 2017).
